title: Sri Lanka’s first wax museum to open at historic Ehelepola Walawwa in Kandy
byline: The country’s first and only wax museum is set to open in a few days at the historic Ehelepola Walawwa in Kandy, marking a significant addition to Sri Lanka’s cultural landscape.

title: UNFPA, Japan and ADT empower 2,000 Sri Lankan women and youth
byline: The United Nations Population Fund (UNFPA), in collaboration with the Government of Japan and the Alliance Development Trust (ADT), launched a programme to strengthen the capacities of over 2,000 women and young people across Sri Lanka on social cohesion, gender equality, sexual and reproductive health and rights, and climate action.

title: Five young students secure 13 wins at World Junior Tourism Meet
byline: Five young students representing Sri Lanka at the 2025 World Junior Tourism Ambassador (WJTA) Competition in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, returned to the country last night (July 1) with an impressive haul of 13 awards.

title: NPP Govt. dreams nuclear energy, yet treads cautiously over geopolitics involved
byline: Sri Lanka, under the new government led by the National People’s Power (NPP) has identified nuclear power in its generation plan while phasing out coal power plants, Daily Mirror learns.

title: Banks dismiss fears of mass parate actions
byline: Licenced commercial banks have pushed back against what they describe as attempts by a small group of borrowers to stir “alarm and confusion” over the potential use of parate laws, saying there is no plan to initiate widespread property seizures following the end of the debt relief period.

title: June tourist arrivals surge with Bohra Convention
byline: Sri Lanka’s tourism sector witnessed a significant uptick in arrivals this June, propelled by the influx of devotees for the Bohra Convention.

title: IMF approves next $350 million tranche
byline: The Executive Board of the International Monetary Fund (IMF) has completed the fourth review under the 48-month Extended Fund Facility (EFF) arrangement, allowing Sri Lanka to draw approximately US$350 million.

title: Malaysia mulls visa-free travel for Sri Lankans
byline: Malaysia’s tourism authorities are throwing their weight behind a proposal for visa-free travel for Sri Lankan citizens as part of broader efforts to strengthen tourism ties between the two countries, a senior official from Tourism Malaysia revealed.

title: Trump threatens Japan with tariff up to 35% as deadline looms
byline: US President Donald Trump has threatened to impose a ’’30% or 35%’’ tariff on Japan if a deal between the two countries is not reached before a deadline next week.

title: Trump says Israel has agreed to conditions for 60-day Gaza ceasefire
byline: Israel has agreed to the ’’necessary conditions’’ to finalise a 60-day ceasefire in Gaza, US President Donald Trump has said.

title: Qantas data breach exposes up to six million customer profiles
byline: Qantas is contacting customers after a cyber attack targeted their third-party customer service platform.

title: Rs. 20 million worth whisky, cigarettes seized at BIA
byline: Two Sri Lankan businessmen were arrested last night at the Bandaranaike International Airport (BIA) for attempting to smuggle a consignment of whisky and cigarettes valued at Rs. 20 million through the airport’s Green Channel.

title: Official: Shah Rukh Khan to visit Sri Lanka on August 2
byline: Colombo is set to witness a star-studded evening as Bollywood icon Shah Rukh Khan will attend the grand opening of City of Dreams Sri Lanka on August 2.

title: Five students secure 13 wins at World Junior Tourism Meet
byline: Five young students representing Sri Lanka at the 2025 World Junior Tourism Ambassador (WJTA) Competition in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, returned to the country last night (July 1) with an impressive haul of 13 awards.

title: Don’t panic! Banks tell SMEs as parate relief ends
byline: Licenced commercial banks have pushed back against what they describe as attempts by a small group of borrowers to stir “alarm and confusion” over the potential use of parate laws, saying there is no plan to initiate widespread property seizures following the end of the debt relief period.

title: Top A/L achievers to get foreign university scholarships
byline: The Cabinet approved a new scholarship programme aimed at providing opportunities for Sri Lanka’s highest-performing students at the G.C.E. Advanced Level (A/L) examinations, to pursue their first degree at internationally ranked foreign universities.

title: Govt. to present 2026 Appropriation Bill to Parliament in October
byline: The Cabinet has approved the proposal to present the Appropriation Bill for 2026 to Parliament in October 2025, with the second reading (budget speech) scheduled for November, followed by the third reading and budget debate in November and December.

title: Special presidential committee to probe past irregularities at SriLankan
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has approved the appointment of a Special Presidential Investigation Committee to examine alleged fraud, corruption, and irregularities that have occurred at SriLankan Airlines Limited and Airport and Aviation (Sri Lanka) (Private) Limited over the past 15 years.

title: Elon Musk’s Starlink now in Sri Lanka
byline: Billionaire entrepreneur Elon Musk has announced that Starlink, his satellite-based internet service, is now available in Sri Lanka.

title: Cabinet approves new method for G2G procurement of pharmaceuticals
byline: The Cabinet of Ministers has granted approval for a new methodology to procure pharmaceuticals and medical appliances under government-to-government arrangements, in a bid to address shortages in the local healthcare system.

title: Police warns against use of offensive language on its Facebook page
byline: Action will be taken against individuals who use offensive or abusive language when commenting on its official Facebook page, the Sri Lanka Police announced

title: Indictments served on Yoshitha Rajapaksa and Daisy Forest
byline: The Colombo High Court today (02) served indictments on Yoshitha Rajapaksa, son of former President Mahinda Rajapaksa, and his grandmother Daisy Forest in connection with a money laundering case.

title: Suspect nabbed with counterfeit US Dollars
byline: A man was arrested with six counterfeit US$100 notes at a bank in Minuwangoda Town, police said.

title: PUCSL holds talks on renewable energy challenges
byline: The Public Utilities Commission of Sri Lanka (PUCSL) will hold a public consultation today (July 2) to identify and address the challenges faced by renewable energy developers in the country.

title: Rayhan Wanniappa appointed acting DG and CEO of CAASL
byline: The Civil Aviation Authority of Sri Lanka (CAASL) has announced the appointment of Rayhan Wanniappa as the Acting Director General of Civil Aviation and Chief Executive Officer.

title: Over 1.1 Mn tourist arrivals in first half of 2025
byline: The total number of tourist arrivals in the first half of 2025 stands at 1,168,044, the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA) reported.

title: Ex-SriLankan Airlines Chairman accused favouring flight attendant in ongoing corruption case
byline: The Commission to Investigate Allegations of Bribery or Corruption (CIABOC) informed the Colombo Chief Magistrate court that former SriLankan Airlines Chairman Nishantha Wickramasinghe misused his authority by repeatedly assigning a female flight attendant to multiple international flights and granting her extra allowances, despite having no familial connection to her.

title: Starlink in Sri Lanka: New pricing and availability details
byline: Following its official launch in Sri Lanka yesterday, Starlink, the satellite-based internet service by SpaceX, has released its pricing options for both residential and business users.

title: ICT sentences Hasina to 6 months in prison
byline: The International Crimes Tribunal (ICT) has sentenced former prime minister Sheikh Hasina to six months in prison in a contempt of court case.

title: SJB begins to remove LG members who had gone against party: Tissa
byline: The Samagi Jana Balawegaya (SJB) has begun an exercise to expel Local Government members who have gone against the party line when electing heads of local bodies where no party had gained an absolute majority, SJB National Organizer Tissa Attanayake said today.

title: Examination of evidence concludes in inquiry against Deshabandu
byline: The examination of evidence before the Committee of Inquiry appointed to investigate into allegations of gross abuse of power by Inspector General of Police (IGP) Deshabandu Tennakoon concluded yesterday (July 1).

title: Navy conducts life-saving training for fishermen
byline: The Sri Lanka Navy in collaboration with the Department of Fisheries and Aquatic Resources conducted an important life-saving training session for local fishermen at the Muthur Fishery Harbour in Trincomalee.

title: Kahawatte OIC transferred to facilitate probe on recent shooting
byline: The Officer-in-Charge (OIC) of the Kahawatte Police has been transferred to the Jaffna Police Division to facilitate the investigation into the youth who was shot dead on June 30 in Kahawatte, Police said.

title: Rajitha Senaratne fails to appear before Bribery Commission, cites illness
byline: Former Fisheries Minister Rajitha Senaratne, who is accused of causing financial losses to the government by allegedly awarding a sand mining project at the Kirinda Fisheries Harbour to a Korean company without following proper procurement procedures, has informed the Bribery Commission today that he is unable to appear for questioning due to ill health.

title: Change education system without becoming laughingstock before international community: Sajith
byline: It is high time that Sri Lanka’s education system is changed to be in line with the changing world, without becoming a laughing stock of the international community, Opposition Leader Sajith Premadasa said referring to the incident at the World Economic Forum involving Minister Sunil Handunetti.

title: Ranil thanks Elon Musk for enabling Starlink in Sri Lanka
byline: Former president Ranil Wickremesinghe has thanked Elon Musk for enabling Starlink satellite internet access for all Sri Lankans.

title: Education Minister calls for urgent measures to end ragging and violence in universities
byline: Education Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya has called for the formulation of comprehensive recommendations and measures to eradicate ragging, harassment, and all forms of violence within the university system and other higher education institutions.

title: Trump ramps up Musk feud with deportation threat
byline: The world’s richest person was Trump’s biggest political donor in the 2024 election, and became his inseparable ally during his first months back in the White House as head of the Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE).

title: Company charged for illegal import of medical devices
byline: The National Medicines Regulatory Authority (NMRA) today filed a case before Colombo Additional Magistrate Pavithra Sanjeewani Pathirana against a Bambalapitiya-based company for the unlawful imports of medical devices, including finger-prick blood glucose testing equipment, alcohol-based sanitisers and medical plasters.

title: CSE ends positive with strong ASPI gains and active market turnover
byline: The Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) concluded the trading day on a positive note, reaching a new record high, supported by growing investor confidence and increased market activity. Overall sentiment remained upbeat, driven largely by the announcement that the International Monetary Fund (IMF) Executive Board has approved the fourth review under the Extended Fund Facility (EFF) for Sri Lanka.

title: MoUs to be signed with four countries on G2G procurement of pharmaceuticals: Nalinda
byline: Four countries inclduing Pakistan, Bangladesh, India and Indonesia have already submitted a list of pharmaceuticals to be supplied on government to government arrangements and Sri Lanka will sign a Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) with these countries soon, Cabinet Spokesman, Health Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said.

title: Court issues notices on respondents over writ petition against Archchuna
byline: The Court of Appeal today issued formal notices on the respondents over the writ application challenging the eligibility of Jaffna District Parliamentarian Dr. Ramanathan Archchuna to serve as a Member of Parliament.

title: Fuel price formula, most reasonable methodology currently available: Nalinda
byline: The fuel price formula which was introduced by the previous government is the most reasonable methodology available right now to mete out justice to the people, pay back loans of the Ceylon Petroleum Corporation (CPC) and to manage past financial irregularities, Cabinet Spokesman, Minister Dr. Nalinda Jayatissa said today.

title: Infant’s skeleton, toy, school bag unearthed at Chemmani mass grave
byline: An infant’s skeleton, a small toy and a school bag were unearthed when the five and a half days of excavation at the Chemmani mass grave site in Jaffna was concluded.

title: Wildlife officers to launch trade union action on July 9
byline: The Wildlife Conservation Officers’ Association (WCOU) today announced that they will start trade union action on July 9 if the government does not increase their risk allowance and meet other demands.
